Articles.Content:
I orbited a sattilite recently, its top speed is around 2300.0m/s and did a full orbit that only took 40min.

Screenshots:

> ![pjCkj.png](http://i.imgur.com/pjCkj.png)
> ![I28w5.png](http://i.imgur.com/I28w5.png)
> 
> ![YBVfd.png](http://i.imgur.com/YBVfd.png)
> 
> ![QjWpX.png](http://i.imgur.com/QjWpX.png)
> 
> ![mHHQ6.png](http://i.imgur.com/mHHQ6.png)
Congratulations, and yes, the name of the planet is, in fact, Kerbin.
Well all an orbital speed (and therefore your period) depends on is altitude. So you can\'t just 'make the orbit go faster' at a low altitude - the orbital distance will increase with speed.
